page.title: 12RAMBLER'S ASSOCIATION
page.content: At a meeting in Heathfield Comprehensive School in 1977 attended by many interested people it was decided to see if there was sufficient support for a Rambler's Association to be established.A public meeting was then held. This attracted 200 people and the Wealden Cuckoos Ramblers' Association was formed.They chose this name because the association was to be based in Heathfield and it is here that a legend says "The first cuckoo was let out of a basket by an old woman on April 14th" The Wealden Cuckoos are responsible for the maintenance of footpaths within a 10 mile radius of Heathfield. They also,with the support of Parish Councils,rebuild stiles,build bridges and clear paths.The group is especially concerned with the Cuckoo Line, a disused railway line.
